Terror Factory: Inside the FBI's Manufactured War on Terrorism is a book written by investigative journalist Trevor Aaronson. The book was published in 2013 and it offers a critical examination of the FBI's tactics in fighting terrorism since the September 11th attacks in 2001. Aaronson argues that the FBI has used these tactics to inflate the threat of terrorism and to justify its continued expansion of its powers and budgets. He also claims that many of the individuals targeted by these operations have no prior history of terrorism or violent activity, and that the FBI has created the terrorist threat in order to justify its actions.

The book received a positive reception from critics and has been praised for its comprehensive and in-depth examination of the FBI's tactics in fighting terrorism. However, some have criticized the book's conclusions as being one-sided and overly critical of the FBI, and have argued that the book does not give sufficient consideration to the challenges and complexities of fighting terrorism.
